title: saotchynakamuro
author: saotchynakamuro
content: The "Crypton Exchange," which has received a lot of attention on BitcoinTalk, is run by con artists like "Bitstar_coin."The "company" is 1984 GROUP LP, according to the website https://crp.is/.A quick search reveals that it has been DISSOLVED more than four times! https://find-and-update.company-information.service.gov.uk/company/SL021781/filing-historyIt is not a company at all, but rather a partnership formed by a group of Lithuanian con artists, led by REMIGIJUS MIKALAUSKAS. REMIGIJUS MIKALAUSKAS, a Lithuanian scam artist, has more than 30 dissolved "companies.": http://www.checkcompany.co.uk/director/1254050/MR-REMIGIJUS-MIKALAUSKASYou welcome!

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.created_time: December 12, 2022, 12:39:39 PMLast edit: December 13, 2022, 07:07:33 AM by Doan9269
comments.body: OP if i can get you right what you're trying to do is laying an accusation on a crypto exchange on bitcoin discussion which is absolutely wrong, we have boards assigned for each category of discussion matters, yours could fit in on reputation or you go to scam accusation should in case you have that strong conviction the exchange scammed with proofs, and if you're talking about exchanges in general and not an accusation was your intention, then beginners and help, economics or altcoins discussion boards can best fit in for your discussion.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Quote from: saotchynakamuro on December 12, 2022, 10:24:42 AMThe "Crypton Exchange," which has received a lot of attention on BitcoinTalkYou welcome! I don't think that many users on bitcointalk have actually heard about this exchange, if any at all. Specially when searching it on coinmarketcap it is near the bottom of the list (176 out of 240) of exchanges with a very low daily volume which means not that many users actually know about or use this service!In any case this is the wrong board as @Doan9269 pointed out. Use the move topic button at the bottom of this page to move it.

comments.author: coupable
comments.body: This is one of the platforms that was created for the purpose of fraud and misrepresentation to provide any other service.  Its legitimacy is usually derived from the fact that it is only listed on CoinMarketCap and offers weak pairs for trading against two or three major currencies.  All that matters is to encourage as many people as possible to make deposits.  In fact, more than 90 percent of the 230 exchanges listed on CoinMarketCap are scams and completely unreliable .

comments.author: saotchynakamuro
comments.body: All evidence is provided above.You should never deposit money or do business with anyone who has this scam as their signature on BitcoinTalk or anywhere else.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: I'm not familiar with that exchange, and this is the first time I've heard of it. Even I have no idea what happened. Assuming they shut down and start scamming people. What else can you expect from such an exchange? Running advertisements or signature campaigns on the forum does not prove the legitimacy of an exchange. However, belief in exchange has become difficult in nowadays. The majority of them are quite shady. Simply be cautious.

comments.author: RapTarX
comments.body: You haven't shared anything from bitcointalk. Do they have any account on bitcointalk or any announcement thread on bitcointalk? I have heard the name for the first time; probably because I wasn't much active lately. But many of the forum members haven't heard about it I guess as I can see few replies from the above.Your complain here without any of their bitcointalk account or without the announcement thread doesn't mean anything. They ahave nothing to lose here LOL.

comments.author: saotchynakamuro
comments.body: Do I need to prove you're another con artist? I'd be delighted to create a topic about you and your shit that you promote in your signature.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: @saotchynakamuro If you want us to do something about it and potentially stop their signature campaign, you will have to provide more evidence. Its not just enough to mention their alleged CEO, list of his ex companies and say that he is a con artist, without providing some proof that he was behind scams. So please put some effort into this and make a proper scam accusation post in which you will provide as much info as possible. Quote from: pooya87 on December 12, 2022, 01:04:50 PMSpecially when searching it on coinmarketcap it is near the bottom of the list (176 out of 240) of exchanges with a very low daily volume which means not that many users actually know about or use this service!Hm are you sure that's the same exchange because from what I can see, the one you found on CMC is called Cryptonex, not Crypton Exchange. Anyway, I couldn't find this Crypton Exchange on either Coingecko or CMC. What I could find though is their token called Crypton.

comments.author: saotchynakamuro
comments.body: If you can't read the first post on the topic, you must be a complete moron.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.created_time: December 12, 2022, 09:46:09 PMLast edit: December 13, 2022, 09:19:27 AM by Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: saotchynakamuro on December 12, 2022, 08:33:13 PM...I just checked your post history and its obvious that you came here to troll and not do some actual good for this community or to have a normal discussions so you are going on ignore.

comments.author: saotchynakamuro
comments.body: You can either respond to the topic or keep your mouth shut.You are the only one who is trolling right now.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: Is there any flag on Crypton exchange? not yet.Is there any active scam accusations on Crypton exchange? not yet.Is there any relation between the CEO's history to his current exchange? maybe, but not really a strong evidence.If you think they're scam, you should leave negative tag and flag their account who post the ANN thread in this forum Bitcoin is available on NO KYC Crypton Exchange.
